abstract.p: Louis Vuitton publishes City Guides for travelers looking for haute shopping and dining in Europe; photo (Pulse column) (S)

block.p: Victorians carried their Baedekers, and backpackers tote ''Let's Go.'' Now for the highflying nomad, Louis Vuitton introduces City Guides, a seven-volume paperback set for travelers who want to know, say, which Paris bistro the Jean-Paul Gaultier staff prefers. (Le Square Trousseau.) Featuring 30 European destinations, the City Guides eschew star ratings, including only hotels that can be categorized as ''luxurious,'' ''trendy'' or ''charming.'' They excel on restaurants, cafe bars and shopping, shopping, shopping. Where to get Iranian caviar in Prague? (Flambee.) Haute hippie-wear in London? (The Cross.) Available at Saks, Bloomingdales, Macy's and Louis Vuitton (49 East 57th Street), the guides come in a plain cardboard box ($50), or a leather case ($125). But don't throw out the Michelin. The guides are featherweight on culture, with three times as much on Prada as the Prado.
